articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Ugandan President
Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of sympathy to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, President of Uganda, in connection with bomb explosions that occurred in Uganda by the extreme armed forces, claiming dozens of human losses.
					Kim in the message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the President and, through him, to the bereaved families, hoping that the Ugandan government and people would achieve the durable peace and stability of the country as early as possible by their positive efforts.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Leaves to Attend World Conference
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Leaves to Attend World Conference
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and his party left here today to participate in the third world conference of speakers of parliament to be held in Geneva.
					 They were seen off at the airport by Vice-Chairman of the SPA Kim Wan Su, officials concerned, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and Charge d'Affaires ad Interim of the Russian embassy here Alexander Matsegora.

articles.title: Order Awarded to North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Complex
articles.content:
Order Awarded to North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Complex
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Il Sung was conferred upon the North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex in recognition of the heroic feats performed by the complex. The complex successfully carried out the behest of President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, by successfully completing the Taegyedo Tideland reclamation project, weathering all sorts of trials in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude in order to translate his far-reaching idea of great nature-remaking into reality, invariably remaining true to his thought and leadership.
					 A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was promulgated on Saturday in this regard.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Design for Taegyedo Tideland
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Design for Taegyedo Tideland
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Sung Prize was conferred on the design for Taegyedo Tideland reclamation which greatly contributed to successfully building one more gigantic structure in the era of the Workers' Party, the project that resulted in obtaining arable land equal to the area of one county and radically changing the appearance of the land of the country true to the behest of President Kim Il Sung.
					 A relevant decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was promulgated on July 17.

articles.title: Rev. Han Sang Ryol Meets Religionists
articles.content:
Rev. Han Sang Ryol Meets Religionists
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Rev. Han Sang Ryol of south Korea met with religionists at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Friday.
					 Present there were members of the Chondoist Association of Korea, the Christian Federation of Korea, the Buddhist Federation of Korea and the Catholic Association of Korea.
					
					 Rev. Han said that although he is a Christian, he came to have relation with other religions, living a life full of turns and twists and it has grown deeper through the process for solidarity and alliance. 
					
					 That he came to Pyongyang beyond the wall of division was to revive the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration as a man of religion praying for genuine peace, he held.
					
					 He called upon all the believers in the south and the north of Korea to pool their strength, revive the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration, drive out foreign forces and advance along the path for independent reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation.
					
					 Members of the above-said religious organizations referred to the fact that the new era of national reconciliation and unity and peaceful reunification was ushered in and precious fruitions were achieved during the past decade after the historic Pyongyang summit and the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 They underscored the need for believers in the north and the south to unite close under the banner of "By our nation itself" putting the interests of the nation above all and courageously turn out in the struggle to bravely smash the moves of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: DPRK Beats New Zealand in Women's Football
articles.content:
DPRK Beats New Zealand in Women's Football
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's football team trounced its New Zealand rival 2:1 in its second game of league matches in FIFA U-20 Womenâ€™s World Cup 2010.
					 Yun Hyon Hi successfully scored a goal in around 12th minute of the first half and Kim Un Hyang succeeded in a penalty kick in around 65th minute in the second half of the game that took place on Saturday (Pyongyang time).
					
					 Through this win the DPRK team gained total of six points, opening a bright prospect for advancing into quarter finals.
					
					 The DPRK team will meet with its Swedish rival on July 20 in the last game of league matches.

articles.title: Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" Staged in China
articles.content:
Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" Staged in China
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" was performed by Korean artistes in Shenyang, the capital of Liaoning Province, China on July 12 and 13.
					 The Liaoning Grand Theatre was packed to its capacity with audiences on those days. 
					
					 On July 13, in particular, a lot of Shenyangites gathered in the plaza of the grand theatre and danced to the tune of Korean songs, presenting a spectacular scene.
					
					 The performances were enjoyed by personages and other Chinese of the province and Shenyang City and Korean residents there. 
					
					 After watching the performance, Chen Zhenggao, governor of Liaoning Province, said that Korean artistes successfully represented the thematic contents of the original work. The Chinese literary and art circles must be greatly touched by the performance, he added. 
					
					 Zeng Wei, secretary of the Shenyang City Committee of the Communist Party of China, said that "A Dream of Red Mansions", well known to all Chinese, occupies an important position in the history of Chinese literature. 
					
					 Not only the novel but also the opera are a masterpiece, he said, and went on:
					
					 Korean artistes impressively depicted the Chinese work on a high level on the basis of their correct understanding and grasp of it.
					
					 The opera is very popular.
					
					 The Phibada Opera Troupe gave splendid performances before Shenyangites. 
					
					 Choe Un Bok, chairperson of the General Association of Koreans in China, after appreciating the performance, said that it enhanced the pride and honor as a member of the Korean nation, adding that the attraction of the opera is great.
					
					Choe highly praised General Secretary Kim Jong Il as a genius of arts.

articles.title: Posters Produced for WPK Conference
articles.content:
Posters Produced for WPK Conference
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Posters have been produced in the DPRK to further encourage the army and people to the advance for a great surge in building a prosperous and powerful nation on the occasion of the forthcoming conference of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Depicted in posters produced by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House is the emblem of the WPK.
					
					 Poster "Greet the conference of the Workers' Party of Korea as an auspicious event which will shine forever in the history of our party and country!" represents the army and people of the DPRK dynamically conducting the general offensive for the improvement of the  standard of people's living with deep emotion and joy at the forthcoming conference. 
					
					 Poster "With high degree of political enthusiasm and admirable labor achievements!" shows the revolutionary spirit of the servicepersons and people determined to present signal labor achievements to the WPK conference.

articles.title: Cocoon Harvest at High Peak
articles.content:
Cocoon Harvest at High Peak
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Harvest of spring cocoons is in full swing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Cocoon farms throughout the country, in response to the call of the Workers' Party of Korea for increasing the silk production, have reaped a good cocoon crop by raising silkworms in a scientific and technological way.
					
					 Officials of the Sericulture and Silk Production Guidance Bureau and provincial sericultural sectors, with a high goal to make a fresh upswing in cocoon production this year, have found themselves in cocoon farms and properly carried on organizational and political works to harvest cocoons in time without any waste.
					
					 Kangdong, Sadong, Rangnang, Hyongjesan and other cocoon farms in Pyongyang have taken the lead in harvesting cocoons.
					
					 Those in South Hwanghae Province have operated drying grounds at full capacity to dry large quantities of cocoons every day.
					
					 Such achievements have also been reported from South Hamgyong, North Phyongan, North Hwanghae and Kangwon Provinces.

articles.title: US Urged to Roll Back Its Policy of Double Standards
articles.content:
US Urged to Roll Back Its Policy of Double Standards
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. unfair policy of double standards is not only a source of disturbing the international peace and stability but a stumbling block in establishing fair international relations.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Israel's nuclear weaponization has gone beyond the danger line and its aggressor forces are going on the rampage in the occupied territory of Palestine because of the U.S. zealous support and patronage. 
					
					 The ulterior aim of the U.S. is to use Israel as a "trump card" in putting under its control Iran, a main stumbling block in realizing its strategy for dominating the Middle East. While making desperate efforts to deprive Iran of the right to nuclear activities for peaceful purposes the U.S. is keeping mum about Israel's evermore undisguised nuclear threat and blackmail and encouraging it behind the scene. This attitude is a most vivid manifestation of the U.S. application of its double standards. 
					
					 Israel has recently committed such bestial atrocities as barbarously attacking an international humanitarian aid flotilla in the open sea on its way to Gaza, claiming dozens of casualties.  
					
					 The U.S., however, supported and defended criminals, laying bare itself as a disturber of Mideast peace and an accomplice in human rights abuses. 
					
					 What is more intolerable is that the U.S. worked hard to shield Israel's terrorism even at the UN and zealously backed the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who orchestrated an anti-DPRK conspiratorial farce, crying out for tightening the "sanctions" and the like against it in a bid to do harm to it. This is nothing but an intolerable insult and infringement upon the dignity and authority of the DPRK and a typical example of the unreasonable application of double standards. 
					
					 The U.S. biased and double-dealing attitude goes to prove that it is a special class political gambler who shows "leniency" to its servants and pressurizes and isolates and stifles those countries hostile toward it by branding them as "criminals" through all sorts of slanders and plots. 
					
					 The world can never be in peace and the international relations cannot but remain complicated as long as the U.S. is allowed to persist in its unfair policy of double standards in collusion with its allied forces.

articles.title: Poor Excuse of S. Korean Conservatives over "Cheonan" Case Assailed
articles.content:
Poor Excuse of S. Korean Conservatives over "Cheonan" Case Assailed
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative group is working hard to attach some "meaning" to the presidential statement issued by the United Nations Security Council as regards the "Cheonan" case, saying it was apparently a "warning message" served to someone and that the international community has "denounced the north's attack on warship 'Cheonan'" in unison.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 This was an excuse and clumsy rigmarole of those who were driven into a tight corner with a big defeat they sustained in their anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					
					 The conservative group, much upset by this, is letting loose a string of sheer lies to give impression that it is internationally "supported" while interpreting the contents of the presidential statement its own way. But the eyes of the public opinion are too bright that the group can hardly mislead the people's mindset through such a poor rhetoric.
					
					 The conservative group is miscalculated if it thinks it can conceal its monstrous crimes with such a lame excuse.
					
					 Those with sound reason and thinking faculty have seen through the truth of the anti-DPRK smear campaign orchestrated by the puppet group from the beginning.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should clearly understand that no excuses will help it get rid of the dilemma.
					
					 They had better roll back their foolish anti-DPRK smear campaign which escalates the confrontation and tension, receive the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and sincerely come out for the north-south joint investigation into the case as the UNSC issued the presidential statement.
					
					 There is no other way out for them at present.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Confrontation Racket Bound to Go Bust
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Confrontation Racket Bound to Go Bust
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The racket kicked off by the south Korean puppet group to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK over the warship case is nothing but a deliberate and premeditated plot to bring the inter-Korean relations to a complete collapse and start a war of aggression against the DPRK in league with foreign forces. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 As was the case with all rackets for confrontation with compatriots kicked up by the successive sycophants and traitors of south Korea serving the U.S., the recent warship case faked up by the Lee Myung Bak group was unprecedented in its heinous, crafty and persistent nature. 
					
					 The Lee group so busied itself visiting its American and Japanese masters in a bid to beg them to tighten sanctions against the DPRK and step up "joint actions" against it and seek "cooperation" at the UN Security Council, etc. but the above-said anti-DPRK campaign has totally gone bust. 
					
					 It is the first time in the history of south Korea that it is threatened with an extreme crisis in the middle of a ruler's office though it was usually seen at the end of his tenure of office. 
					
					 South Korean public anger and popular resistance against the reckless moves of the conservative group to bring the inter-Korean relations to a collapse and provoke a war against the DPRK are shaking the dictatorial regime to its very foundation and driving the group of traitors to a bottomless abyss of ruin. This group cooked up the warship case in a bid to do harm to the DPRK but this ended up throwing the group into a trap dug by itself. 
					
					 When looking back on history, all the policies defying the trend of the times and the mindset of the people are fated without exception to go bankrupt and the dictators who spearheaded their enforcement meet their ends, cursed and censured by the people. The same fate awaits the Lee group.

articles.title: "Alliance" for Aggression Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Alliance" for Aggression Assailed in S. Korean
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Ten civic and social, youth and students and religious organizations in south Korea including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and the Confederation of Trade Unions held the 130th "action for independence, reunification and peace" on July 13 to slam the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group to tighten the "alliance".
					 The above-said bodies accused the U.S. chief executive and traitor Lee Myung Bak of recently asserting the extension of the "transfer of the wartime operation control" was attributable to "world security" and the like.
					
					 They also accused the U.S. and the south Korean diplomatic and military chiefs of planning to hold a confab in Seoul.
					
					 They charged that all these actions are threatening peace as they are aimed at carrying out the U.S. strategy for world domination and putting the "alliance" for aggression on a permanent basis.
					
					 The organizations urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to halt at once their moves aimed at boosting the master-servant relations between them and tightening their "alliance" for aggression and come out for dialogue and negotiations for the peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Include Korean Schools in Assistance List
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Include Korean Schools in Assistance List
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and those concerned of the Korean schools demanded the Japanese government include Korean schools in Japan in the list of assistance for senior high schools on July 9.
					 That day Ri Sang U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Teachers and School Clerks in Japan, Pak Ki Bom, chief of the General Affairs Department of the Union of Korean Education Association in Japan, Kim Sun On, chief director of Tokyo Korean School, and Kim Su On, vice-chairman of the Educational Association of Tokyo Korean Middle Higher School, conveyed a written request addressed to the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan and a paper carrying signatures of at least 3 670 retired teachers in different parts of Japan to the ministry.
					
					 They accused the Japanese authorities of turning deaf ear to the voices of people from all strata calling for including Korean schools in the above-said list.
					
					 They clarified that the Japanese people are also opposed to the exclusion of Korean schools only from the list.
					
					 They denounced the Japanese authorities' national discrimination, saying that students who should be indulged in study should not be made to worry that they are subject to discrimination.

articles.title: US Moves for Aggression against DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
US Moves for Aggression against DPRK Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held round-table talks on July 14 to denounce the U.S. imperialists' moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 At the round-table talks speakers branded the U.S. imperialists as hateful aggressors and war provocateurs who brought horrible war disasters to the Korean Peninsula six decades ago.
					
					 They recalled that the U.S. imperialists, not content with hurling huge aggressor forces during the war, conducted an all-out germ and chemical warfare though it was strictly banned by international law, and destroyed and burned everything in the northern half of Korea including cities and villages, factories, farms, schools and even hospitals.
					
					 History records many wars, but it does not know such ferocious man-killers hell-bent on merciless murder and destruction as the U.S. imperialists, they charged, and continued:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are still persisting in their moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK, not abandoning their ambition for invasion even though they suffered a crushing defeat in the Korean war, the first of its kind in their history. Recently, they instigated the Lee Myung Bak group to cook up the warship case, rendering the situation on the Korean Peninsula extremely tense. 
					
					 Should the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group unleash a war at any costs, the DPRK that has built up powerful war deterrent in every way under the great banner of Songun will deal a telling blow at the aggressors.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Ideological and Theoretical Feats Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Ideological and Theoretical Feats Lauded
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Juzef Lachut, chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party, made public a statement on July 9 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 He said:
					
					 The President studied the issue concerning the socio-historical development centered on the man, the first of its kind in the history of human thought, and fathered the Juche idea on that basis.
					
					 He proved the validity, scientific accuracy and vitality of the Juche idea in practice.
					
					 It would be unthinkable without the Songun policy that the DPRK is focusing all its efforts on the building of an economic power despite the acute situation in which it is standing in confrontation with the U.S. styling itself the world's "only superpower." 
					
					 Whenever we talk about the Songun policy, we would like to highly praise the immortal ideological and theoretical feats of the President, the founder of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 We Polish friends are rejoiced over the successes being registered by the Korean people and express full solidarity with them.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated by CPG
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated by CPG
						
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Germany (CPG) held in Berlin on July 3 discussed the issue of grandly commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The plenary meeting proposed the issue of the activities of the German Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung as a separate agenda item.
					
					 The meeting decided on making an interim review of the work of the preparatory committee in November, issuing its bulletin introducing the brilliant revolutionary career of the President and his immortal feats and serially carrying his short biography on the organ of the party and on carrying out the plans of the central and local party organizations to widely organize such political and cultural events as a seminar and film show on important occasions.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated 
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association jointly issued a special bulletin on July 8 to commemorate the 16th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The bulletin in articles titled "The father of the people", "The great man of the century" and "Kim Il Sung, for reunified country" introduced the immortal exploits the President performed before the country and the people, the times and the revolution.
					
					 It recalled that the President dedicated himself to the happiness of the people, finding himself among them all his life, founded the immortal Juche idea, clearly indicating the way for mankind to follow, made a great contribution to the cause of global independence and that he was profoundly revered by all people for his warm humanity, broad magnanimity, rare wisdom and preeminent strategy.
					
					 Noting that Kim Il Sung considered great national unity as the top priority task for achieving the reunification of the country, the bulletin said that he devoted his great wisdom and energies to the work to independently reunify the country divided by foreign forces till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered 
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, film shows and book and photo exhibitions took place in Bangladesh, Russia, Austria and India between July 5 and 7 to commemorate the 16th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display in their venues were books and photos on the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung and the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il and vitality of the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films on the external activities of the President and the tremendous vitality of the Juche idea.
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 Ahsan, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, said that the Bangladeshi people join the Korean people in paying highest tribute to Kim Il Sung commemorating the anniversary of his demise that fell on July 8. He highly praised the exploits performed by the President.
					
					 Semyonov, chairman of the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries, said that Kim Il Sung performed great exploits for the cause of socialism and the cause of global independence. The Korean people are victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause of Juche started by the President under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					 Erich Zavadil, vice-chairman of the Austrian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, noted that the cause of national reunification of Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the DPRK, has been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Austria.

articles.title: Portavoz del CNDPC condena el ejercicio belico maritime
articles.content:
Portavoz del CNDPC condena el ejercicio belico maritimo
Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ATCC) -- En estos dias, los belicistas titeres surcoreanos anuncian que libraran dentro del mes en curso el ejercicio conjunto maritimo con Estados Unidos, que se habian propuesto como "contramedida" al caso de hundimiento del buque de guerra "Cheonan", y realizaran sostenidamente hasta fines de este ano mas de 10 ejercicios belicos, incluido "Ulji Freedom Guardian", y el ejercicio antisubmarinos en los mares Este, Oeste y Sur de Corea.
					  En la 26a "reunion de la iniciativa de la politica de seguridad" sostenida el dia 9 en Washington, la banda de titeres surcoreanos debatio con EE.UU. sobre el citado entrenamiento maritimo. 
					
					Ademas, piensa publicar el detallado plan de acciones en las "conversaciones ministeriales de Relaciones Exteriores y Defensa Nacional" con EE.UU. que tendran lugar el dia 21 en Seul.
					
					  Por otra parte, los belicistas de la capa militar de EE.UU. hablan de que enviaran el portaaviones nuclear "George Washington" y muchas otras fuerzas armadas de la septima flota a las aguas maritimas del Sur de Corea para realizar el ejercicio conjunto mucho mas grande que los anteriores ejercicios militares conjuntos.
					
					  En una declaracion publicada el dia 16 al respecto, el portavoz del Comite Nacional de Defensa de la Paz de Corea (CNDPC) califico ese entrenamiento militar de acto muy peligroso, que perturba la paz y la seguridad y agrava mas la tension en la Peninsula Coreana y la region del Nordeste Asiatico, y de grave provocacion militar contra la RPDC y lo condeno categoricamente en nombre de toda la nacion coreana y los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz.
					
					  El caso del hundimiento del buque de guerra, utilizado por los titeres surcoreanos y EE.UU. como pretexto de ese ejercicio, fue condenado seriamente por la opinion publica interna y externa al revelarse que fue un complot de punta a cabo, senala el portavoz y continua:
					
					  Aunque la banda titere surcoreana remitio esa farsa contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea a la ONU, paso tremenda pena lejos de recabar el reconocimiento de su "resultado de investigacion".
					
					  El ejercicio conjunto maritimo, que quieren librar a toda costa la banda titere surcoreana y EE.UU., deviene un acto provocativo, aventurero e imperdonable, encaminado a reparar su fracaso diplomatico en la ONU y seguir recurriendo al enfrentamiento, el complot y la campana de sancion contra la RPDC.
					
					  La situacion actual comprueba mas claramente que EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea son los perturbadores de la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region del Nordeste Asiatico y que el caso del buque de guerra fue un complot muy peligroso para provocar la  guerra de agresion al Norte de Corea.
					
					  El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no soslayaran esos provocativos ejercicios belicos de los enemigos.
					
					  Si la banda traidora surcoreana efectua finalmente el ejercicio maritimo con EE.UU., el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea les haran frente rotundo considerandolo como grave violacion de la dignidad y la soberania de la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta incorrecta interpretacion del documento del CS
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta incorrecta interpretacion del documento del CS
Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ATCC) -- La banda de conservadores surcoreanos intenta ahora conceder cierta "importancia" a la declaracion del presidente del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, publicada con respecto al incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan", diciendo que este documento fue "un mensaje claro de advertencia" a alguien y la sociedad internacional denuncio al unisono el "ataque del Norte contra la corbeta Â´CheonanÂ´".
					Esto es una excusa y disparate de los que cayeron en aprieto por su gran derrota en la campana intrigante anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					Si bien la banda de conservadores surcoreanos habla como si contara con el "apoyo" internacional interpretando a su manera el contenido de dicho documento de la ONU, no podra enganar de ninguna manera a la muy despierta opinion publica
					
					Estaria muy equivocada si ella piensa encubrir sus grandes crimenes con tal excusa tan pobre.
					
					Desde el principio, los hombres razonables con sano modo de pensar veian el incidente del "Cheonan" como farsa intrigante de los titeres surcoreanos contra la RPDC. Las autoridades surcoreanas deben darse cuenta de que no podran salir del atolladero con excusas.
					
					Ya que se ha publicado la declaracion del presidente del CS de la ONU, las autoridades surcoreanas deben poner fin a su necia campana intrigante y conflictiva anti-RPDC que agrava el enfrentamiento y la tension, admitir al grupo de inspeccion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y participar sinceramente en la investigacion conjunta Norte-Sur sobre ese caso. No les queda otro remedio a ellas.

articles.title: PCA decide celebrar solemnemente el centenario de Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
PCA decide celebrar solemnemente el centenario de Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ATCC) -- La sesion plenaria del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Alemania (PCA), que tuvo lugar el dia 3 en Berlin, discutio el problema de celebrar con solemnidad el centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					El pleno presento como punto aparte de la agenda el tema de las actividades del comite preparatorio de Alemania para el 100o aniversario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Decidio realizar el balance intermedio en noviembre del ano en curso de los trabajos del citado comite preparatorio, publicar boletines que den a conocer la brillante vida revolucionaria y las imborrables hazanas del Presidente, publicar en serie en el organo del partido la biografia de actividades revolucionarias de este gran hombre y organizar ampliamente diversas actividades politico-culturales como seminarios y encuentros de cine en las instituciones centrales y locales del partido.

articles.title: RPDC gana a Nueva Zelanda en el mundial sub-20
articles.content:
RPDC gana a Nueva Zelanda en el mundial sub-20
						
Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ATCC) -- La seleccion coreana gano por 2 a 1 a la neozelandesa en el segundo partido de las clasificatorias por llaves de la Copa Mundial Femenina Sub-20 de la FIFA 2010.
					En el partido efectuado el dia 17 (hora de Pyongyang), Yun Hyon Hi marco el primer gol espectacular a los 12 minutos del primer tiempo y Kim Un Hyang metio el segundo a los 65 minutos del segundo tiempo aprovechando el penalty.
					
					De esta manera, el once coreano obtuvo 6 puntos en total asegurando su avance a los cuartos de final.
					
					El dia 20, tendra lugar el encuentro RPDC-Suecia como ultimo juego de las clasificatorias del grupo B.
